intro: Weberbauera spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed Weberbauera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
